Module com.example.gamerguard
Package com.example.gamerguard.controller

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
com.example.gamerguard.controller.LoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the login.fxml file. Handles user login functionality.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Serene Coders

  • Constructor Details

      public LoginController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller with the Gamer Guard logo image. Loads the logo image from the specified file path and sets it as the image source for the logoImageView.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • loginButtonOnAction

      public void loginButtonOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event when the login button is clicked. Validates whether the email and password fields are filled. If both fields are filled, calls the validateLogin() method. If any field is empty, updates the loginMessageLabel to prompt the user to enter both email and password.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the login button.

    • signupHyperlinkOnAction

      public void signupHyperlinkOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event triggered when the signup hyperlink is clicked. This method loads the sign-up FXML file and sets the scene to the new sign-up page.
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered by clicking the signup hyperlink
      Throws:
      IOException - if the FXML file cannot be loaded

    • forgotPasswordHyperlinkOnAction

      public void forgotPasswordHyperlinkOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event when the "Forgot Password" hyperlink is clicked.

      This method loads the "otpnosession.fxml" file to display an OTP (One-Time Password) input window. It initializes the new stage with a 600x400 scene and shows the OTP window modally, blocking the current window until the OTP window is closed.

      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the "Forgot Password" hyperlink.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • validateLogin

      public void validateLogin()
      Validates the user's login credentials by checking the database for a matching email and hashed password.

      If a match is found, session information is updated and the dashboard is opened. If no match is found, an error message is displayed. Logs any SQLException or IOException that occurs.

    • openDashboard

      public void openDashboard() throws IOException
      Opens the dashboard scene.

      This method loads the "dashboard.fxml" file to create a new scene and sets it on the current stage. The scene's dimensions are defined by the constants HelloApplication.WIDTH and HelloApplication.HEIGHT. The current stage is obtained from the scene of the loginButton.

      Throws:
      IOException - if the FXML file cannot be loaded.

    • cancelButtonOnAction

      public void cancelButtonOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event when the cancel button is clicked. Retrieves the stage associated with the cancel button's scene and closes it, effectively canceling the current operation.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the cancel button.
